name: ParticipantLiving
title: participantliving
description: Logical Model: A pattern followed by resources that represent the participant in some activity, process, or responsible for providing information about a resource.

element.definition: A pattern followed by resources that represent the participant in some activity, process, or responsible for providing information about a resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The date of birth for the individual
element.definition: The date of birth for the individual.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Administrative Gender - the gender that the participant is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.
element.requirements: Needed for identification of the individual, in combination with (at least) name and birth date.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

extension.valueString: The gender of a person used for administrative purposes.

element.requirements: Many EHR systems have the capability to capture an image of the participant. Fits with newer social media usage too.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The language which can be used to communicate with the participant
element.definition: The ISO-639-1 alpha 2 code in lower case for the language, optionally followed by a hyphen and the ISO-3166-1 alpha 2 code for the region in upper case; e.g. "en" for English, or "en-US" for American English versus "en-AU" for Australian English.
element.requirements: Most systems in multilingual countries will want to convey language. Not all systems actually need the regional dialect.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
